the show where the lowest scorers

2522.00.text:
Revolver,
there's all those jingly ones.

2526.00.text:
# Turn off your mind, relax... #
I would have gone for fashion.

2529.00.text:
THEY MUMBLE LYRICS
What's that song called?

2532.00.text:
You chose The Beatles,
darling, so...

2533.00.text:
He Said She Said...
He Said She Said.

2536.00.text:
Tracks on... Let's think of
a track on Abbey Road.

2539.00.text: Abbey Road. Now, that must be...

2540.00.text:
Love Me Do or something?
No. No, of course not.

2542.00.text: Let me think all the way through.

2544.00.text:
I can see them walking across
the zebra crossing.

2546.00.text:
Oh! Darling is on Abbey Road.
Oh! Darling on Abbey Road.

2548.00.text:
We've got one off each now,
so even if...

2550.00.text:
Do you want another one
just thrown in extra?

2552.00.text:
If you want to keep...
We've got 23 seconds.

2554.00.text:
See if there are
any more obscure ones.

2556.00.text:
Well, in that case, Her Majesty
on Abbey Road. Her Majesty.

2560.00.text:
Don't mind if you do, ma'am.
LAUGHTER

2563.00.text:
I'm Only Sleeping on Revolver,
of course, is...

2568.00.text:
# What goes on in your heart? #
LOUIE MUMBLES LYRICS

2570.00.text:
That's it, yeah.
Yeah, that one. Yeah.

2574.00.text:
And Oh! Darling... Oh, darling!
There we go. Your time is up.

2577.00.text: Now, which three are you going to do?

2579.00.text:
You said the most obscure one
on Rubber Soul, the first one...

2582.00.text:
What Goes On. What Goes On.
What Goes On, Rubber Soul.

2584.00.text:
From...? From Rubber Soul.
Rubber Soul.

2586.00.text:
He Said She Said.
He Said She Said from...?

2588.00.text:
# He said, I know what it's... #
LOUIE MUMBLES LYRICS

2591.00.text:
And Her Majesty from Abbey Road.
From Abbey Road.

2593.00.text:
And Her Majesty.
Thank you very much, ma'am.

2596.00.text:
OK, now, of those three,
which do you think is the most...

2598.00.text:
Your best shot at a pointless
answer? The most obscure?

2601.00.text:
I think What Goes On on Rubber Soul.
I'd go with the Rubber Soul.

2605.00.text:
The least likely to be pointless,
do you think?

2608.00.text:
Probably... I think people
might know Her Majesty from...

2611.00.text:
So, we'll put Her Majesty first,
from Abbey Road.

2614.00.text:
Let's pop those answers
up on the board and here they are.

2622.00.text:
Very, very best of luck.
Thank you.

2625.00.text:
I would like to think
all three of them are pointless.

2627.00.text:
I mean, it'd be nice, wouldn't it?
That'd be fantastic.

2630.00.text: Do we get three times the amount?

2631.00.text:
No, you get 30 times the amount,
which is...

2633.00.text:
No, we don't! You're lying.
No, you don't. I'm afraid you get...

2636.00.text:
But however, listen, will you just
remind us what your charities are?

2640.00.text:
Because two wonderful charities
you're playing for.

2642.00.text:
My charity is Crohn's Colitis.
And Rory?

2645.00.text:
Mine is a charity
called Get Connected,

2646.00.text:
which helps teenagers in crisis.
Very good.

2654.00.text: Let's hope one of these answers here

2656.00.text:
will win that jackpot
for those charities.

2658.00.text:
OK. So, we were looking for
rare tracks on Beatles albums.

2662.00.text:
In the first case, we were looking
for tracks on the Abbey Road album.

2666.00.text:
It has to be pointless,
this, for you to win.

2670.00.text:
How many of our 100 people
said Her Majesty?

2679.00.text:
That was the first thing
it had to be.

2681.00.text: I reckon this might do it.

2682.00.text:
The second thing
it has to be is pointless

2684.00.text: and if it is, you'll leave here

2685.00.text:
with that jackpot
for your charities.

2687.00.text:
Down it goes
through single figures.

2699.00.text:
That's a fabulous, fabulous score.
However, it's not pointless.

2703.00.text:
You have two more shots
at today's jackpot.

2706.00.text:
Your second answer
was He Said She Said.

2709.00.text:
In this case, we were looking
for tracks on Revolver.

2713.00.text:
It has to be pointless
for you to win.

2714.00.text:
So, for ?2,500, how many people
said He Said She Said?

2717.00.text: I don't know. I'm so nervous now.

2719.00.text:
I wasn't expecting
to be nervous today at all.

2729.00.text:
Whoa. There'll be a Stewards Enquiry,
don't you worry.

2731.00.text: Are you saying it's not on Revolver?

2733.00.text:
Well, we will discover.
We will discover.

2735.00.text:
Which means you only have one more
shot at today's jackpot. Oh, dear.

2738.00.text:
Everything is now riding
on your third and final answer,

2743.00.text:
In this case, we were looking
for tracks on Rubber Soul.

2747.00.text:
OK. This was your
most confident shot at...

2750.00.text:
Well, afterwards, he said he's not
so confident once he'd said it.

2753.00.text:
LAUGHTER
I'm going to hide behind this.

2755.00.text:
Now, to win the jackpot of ?2,500,
it has to be pointless.

2758.00.text:
Let's find out how many of
our 100 people said What Goes On.

2767.00.text:
Well, your first answer was right
and that took us down to 1.

2770.00.text: Your second answer, He Said She Said,

2774.00.text:
What Goes On takes us now
into single figures.

2776.00.text:
Down it goes.
Still going down.

2779.00.text:
CHEERING AND APPLAUSE
Very well done indeed!

2792.00.text:
What Goes On -
that was a pointless answer,

2795.00.text:
which means you go home
with that jackpot of ?2,500

2805.00.text:
What Goes On is the only
Beatles track - or song - ever

2808.00.text:
with a Lennon, McCartney
and Starkey credit in the writing.

2812.00.text:
Ringo Starr - Richard Starkey -
wrote about five words

2814.00.text: and got a credit for it. Very nice.

2816.00.text:
That's right.
Also sings it, doesn't he?

2820.00.text:
It's She Said She Said is the track
off Revolver, not He Said She Said.

2823.00.text:
Oh, I see!
That's from my elocution lessons.

2827.00.text:
One letter out. But who cares?
Who cares?

2830.00.text: We've won. You won the money.

2831.00.text:
Let's take a look at the pointless
answers on the different albums.

2834.00.text: We will start with Rubber Soul.

2840.00.text:
You also could have had
If I Needed Someone and Wait.

2842.00.text: All of those were pointless answers.

2844.00.text:
Very well done if you got
one of those at home.

2849.00.text:
Here, There And Everywhere is
a pointless answer amazingly. What?!

2852.00.text: I know. It's the most famous song...

2853.00.text:
I Want To Tell You and
I'm Only Sleeping - also pointless.

2856.00.text: You mentioned it in your 60 seconds.

2858.00.text:
I wouldn't have thought
it was pointless, but it was.

2865.00.text:
Oh! Darling -
another song that you'd mentioned.

2870.00.text:
Mean Mr Mustard
is a pointless answer,

2872.00.text:
and You Never Give Me Your Money
also a pointless answer.

2875.00.text:
Very well done if you said
any of those at home.

2877.00.text:
Terrific work in the studio.
Lovely end to our Halloween special.

2880.00.text:
Brilliant performance
from start to finish

2882.00.text:
and a brilliant end to it, as well.
Thank you. Thanks very much.

2885.00.text:
Well, thanks, once again, to
our winning players, Rory and Louie,

2888.00.text:
who go away with today's jackpot
of ?2,500 for their charities.

2892.00.text:
APPLAUSE
Thank you. Thank you. Well done you.

2896.00.text:
Join us next time
when we'll be putting

2898.00.text:
more obscure knowledge
to the test on Pointless.

2900.00.text:
Meanwhile, it's goodbye
from Richard. Goodbye.

2903.00.text: And it's goodbye from me. Goodbye.
